There are two cuppolas. It looks like one is above the bridge and what I assume is the rest of the command and control section.

http://i.imgur.com/e1ugCCt.jpg

ah, never noticed that. thanks

That-yes, but for usual mission it should be similar I guess.

What I am tapking about:

1. Hermes arrives from Mars, ges to high orbit on Lagrange point.

2. Orion docks with Hermes there, astronauts go home in the capsule.

3. Hermes is brought into LEO by remote. That may takes weeks or months.

4. Hermes is refueled and overhauled in LEO.

5. Hermes returns to Lagrange point or high orbit by remote, maybe catches one small probe to top up the fuel (described in book).

6. Orion brings crew to Hermes.

7. Hermes departs.

The point is to avoid astronaut spending weeks on Hermes as Hermes climbs out of Earth gravity well.

And that is how Hermes actually works.

Good job man!

Also the lagrange point you're talking about is EML2.

Is it going to be named Hermes in the game. If you want it to match with stock, I'd say call it "Kermes".

I feel like you don't need to replace the first letter of the name to K to make it stock alike. By that idea, all stock parts would start with a K.

I feel like you don't need to replace the first letter of the name to K to make it stock alike. By that idea, all stock parts would start with a K.

I find it odd that the loading screen splash text "adding K to every word" planted this idea in everyone's head, but in-game hardly anything has a K added to it.

I feel like the proper way to "Kerbalize" a name is just to make it silly.

I find it odd that the loading screen splash text "adding K to every word" planted this idea in everyone's head, but in-game hardly anything has a K added to it.

I feel like the proper way to "Kerbalize" a name is just to make it silly.

Agreed!

If anyone wants to test the MDV right now we have an early version ready: Dropbox Download

No problem here. You put the AresExploration folder into your GameData folder, right? You don't pull the MDV folder out of it...

No problem here. You put the AresExploration folder into your GameData folder, right? You don't pull the MDV folder out of it...

Yep, that's what I did. I'll try it again, though.

Okay so I figured out what's wrong with the files.

In your part configs they're asking for the path "AresExploration/Parts/MDV/heat" which is the path for the heat shield.

So this needs to be the download so they can just drag and drop the folder into the gamedata

(Download for anyone who is having my type of problem)

https://www.dropbox.com/s/4blmzol03ewg4vc/AresExploration.rar?dl=0
